title: Workshop on Instructional Design Practice Methods through Collaborative Research

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Practice-Centered Course for In-Service Language Educators to Collaboratively Explore Research Methods and Systematically Analyze Complex Instructional Design Processes

learning_goals: Learners can clearly explain the core phases of the instructional design research process: problem definition, methodology selection, data collection, and interpretation.
Learners can analyze and document the tacit judgments and values of instructional design practitioners in collaborative environments.
Learners can identify conceptual/practical challenges in multicultural team settings and develop solution strategies.
Learners can develop an instructional design model applicable to real-world language education cases through project-based assessment.

resources: Zoom account and real-time collaboration tools (e.g., Miro, Google Workspace)
Instructional design case study resource package

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
